intro: Paepalanthus yapacanensis var. yapacanensis, commonly known as the Yapacanensis Burrobrush, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. This species is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant in high-altitude environments.
